info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:12PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lake, northwestern Missoula and southeastern Sanders Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Paradise, or 16 miles northeast of Superior, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Visibility as low as one-half mile and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Old Agency, Dixon, Moiese and Perma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
